sentences.en: A bright shooting star, or meteor, is an unforgettable sight.
sentences.cn: 明亮的流星，或者说陨石，是番难忘的景象。

sentences.en: a singer selected from hundreds of applicants with stars in their eyes.
sentences.cn: 从数百名乐滋滋的申请者中挑选出来的一名歌手。

sentences.en: An astronomer can determine the brightness of each star.
sentences.cn: 天文学家能够测定每颗恒星的亮度。

sentences.en: By the age of 20, she was already a big star (= a very famous and successful performer ) .
sentences.cn: 她20岁时就已经是大明星了。

sentences.en: During the filming, Curtis fell in love with his co-star, Christine Kaufmann.
sentences.cn: 在电影摄制过程中，柯蒂斯爱上了同他联袂主演的明星克里斯汀·考夫曼。

sentences.en: Eagle Star offers a 10% discount to the over-55s.
sentences.cn: 鹰星公司给予年龄在55岁以上的顾客10％的折扣。

sentences.en: Has somebody helped himself to some film star's diamonds?
sentences.cn: 有人偷了某个影星的钻石了吗?

sentences.en: He had been a cub reporter for the Kansas City Star.
sentences.cn: 他曾是《堪萨斯城市星报》的一名年轻记者。

sentences.en: I lay on my back and looked up at the stars.
sentences.cn: 我仰卧着看天上的星星。

sentences.en: Mind trainers are now part of a tennis star's retinue.
sentences.cn: 现在，网球明星的随行人员中有些是心理培训师。

sentences.en: Prices at three-star hotels fell furthest in several northern cities.
sentences.cn: 3星级宾馆的住宿价格在几个北方城市降得最多。

sentences.en: She has some cockeyed delusions about becoming a pop star.
sentences.cn: 她还幻想着自己能成为流行歌星。

sentences.en: The film opened with a star-studded premiere last night.
sentences.cn: 该影片昨晚举办了明星云集的首映式。

sentences.en: The planet is probably in orbit around a small star.
sentences.cn: 这颗行星可能正环绕着一颗小恒星运行。

sentences.en: The presence of a star is already apparent in the early film.
sentences.cn: 在早期影片中已经显露出了明星相。

sentences.en: The sky was filled with stars.
sentences.cn: 满天繁星。

sentences.en: The star's surface temperature is reckoned to be minus 75 degrees Celsius.
sentences.cn: 这颗恒星的表面温度估计在零下75摄氏度左右。

sentences.en: The stars were all out (= they were shining ) .
sentences.cn: 星耀天空。

sentences.en: The stars were shining .
sentences.cn: 群星闪烁。

sentences.en: The stars were twinkling overhead (= shining and quickly changing from bright to faint ) .
sentences.cn: 头顶上星星闪烁。

sentences.en: This movie made him the most bankable star in Hollywood.
sentences.cn: 这部电影让他一举成为好莱坞最具票房号召力的明星。

sentences.en: To the side of the large star is a smaller star.
sentences.cn: 大星星旁边是一颗小一点的星星。

words.tran_cn: 担任主角的；用星装饰的；用星号标明的；受命运支配的
布满星星的；闪闪发光的；星光照耀的；星形的
演员们；明星界；明星身份
扮演主角，领衔主演；纯锑表面呈星状花纹
使担任主角（star的过去式）；用星（形物）装饰

phrases.tran_cn: 双星（紧密相连的二颗星，借望远镜始可分辨者）
在（某人的）眼中有幸福感：被倾倒或被迷住的，如在浪漫爱情中
有崇高的目标，雄心勃勃
头晕眼花：经历光闪的感觉，如头部被击中时的感觉

trans.tran_en: a large ball of burning gas in space that can be seen at night as a point of light in the sky
a large ball of burning gas in space that can be seen at night as a point of light in the sky

trans.tran_cn: 主演，（在文字等旁）标星号
